_comment: Phoneme to Viseme Mapping for Lip Sync Animation
_description: Maps ARPABET phonemes to viseme indices (0-13) for mouth shape animation

_viseme_descriptions.0: AH, AA - Open mouth, relaxed (ah, father)
_viseme_descriptions.1: AO, OW - Rounded lips, open (aw, go)
_viseme_descriptions.2: EH, ER, EY - Mid-open, slightly spread (get, bird, day)
_viseme_descriptions.3: IH, IY - High front, spread lips (bit, beat)
_viseme_descriptions.4: UH, UW - High back, rounded (book, boot)
_viseme_descriptions.6: F, V - Lower lip to upper teeth (labiodental)
_viseme_descriptions.7: TH, DH - Tongue tip between teeth (dental)
_viseme_descriptions.8: T, D, N, L, R - Tongue tip to alveolar ridge
_viseme_descriptions.9: S, Z - Tongue tip near alveolar, narrow groove (sibilant)
_viseme_descriptions.10: SH, ZH, CH, JH - Tongue blade raised (post-alveolar)
_viseme_descriptions.11: K, G, NG - Tongue back to soft palate (velar)
